```{r}
#| label: executing non-setup R code
#| echo: true
#assigned values to objects
x <- 10
y <- 20
z <- x + y

#constucted a data frame
df <- data.frame(
  Name = c("Andres", "Blanca", "Carlos"),
  Age = c(23, 19, 45),
  Score = c(90, 85, 99))

#defined functions
calculate_mean <- function(numbers) {
  mean(numbers)}

mean_score <- calculate_mean(df$Score)
mean_score
```

```{r}
#| label: descriptive analysis/hypothesis testing
#| echo: true

summary(df)

# df_filtered

ggplot(df, aes(x = Name, y = Score)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "pink") +
  labs(title = "Scores by Name", x = "Name", y = "Score") +
  theme_minimal() #edit this
```

```{r}
#| label: publication quality table, figure, and image
#| echo: false
#table (edit)
df %>%
  kable("html", caption = "Sample Data Frame") %>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed"), full_width = FALSE)
#figure (edit)
ggplot(df, aes(x = Name, y = Score)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "steelblue") +
  labs(title = "Scores by Name", x = "Name", y = "Score") +
  theme_minimal() +

    text = element_text(size = 12),  # Adjust font size

  )

```

The mean score is `r mean_score` .

The highest score in the dataset is `r max(df$Score)` .

The youngest person in the dataset is `r df$Name[which.min(df$Age)]`, who is `r min(df$Age)` years old.

The dataset contains `r nrow(df)` observations, with score ranging from `rmin(df$Score)` to `rmax(df$Score)`.

## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
library(apaquarto)
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
